org.openimaj.ml.clustering.assignment

Interface HardAssigner<DATATYPE,DISTANCES,DISTANCE_INDEX>

  • Type Parameters:
    DATATYPE - the primitive array datatype which represents a centroid of this cluster.
    DISTANCES - primitive array datatype for recording distances between points and cluster centroids.
    DISTANCE_INDEX - datatype for representing an pair.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Assigner<DATATYPE>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ClusterLimitedIntRAC, ConstrainedFloatAssigner, ExactByteAssigner, ExactDoubleAssigner, ExactFloatAssigner, ExactIntAssigner, ExactLongAssigner, ExactShortAssigner, HierarchicalByteHardAssigner, HierarchicalDoubleHardAssigner, HierarchicalFloatHardAssigner, HierarchicalIntHardAssigner, HierarchicalLongHardAssigner, HierarchicalShortHardAssigner, IntRAC, IntRandomForest, KDTreeByteEuclideanAssigner, KDTreeDoubleEuclideanAssigner, KDTreeFloatEuclideanAssigner, KDTreeIntEuclideanAssigner, KDTreeLongEuclideanAssigner, KDTreeShortEuclideanAssigner

    public interface HardAssigner<DATATYPE,DISTANCES,DISTANCE_INDEX>
extends Assigner<DATATYPE>
    The HardAssigner interface describes classes that assign a spatial point to a single cluster.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Method Detail

      • assign

        int[] assign(DATATYPE[] data)
        Assign data to a cluster.
        Parameters:
        data - the data.
        Returns:
        The cluster indices which the data was assigned to.

      • assign

        int assign(DATATYPE data)
        Assign a single point to a cluster.
        Parameters:
        data - datum to assign.
        Returns:
        the cluster index.

      • assignDistance

        void assignDistance(DATATYPE[] data,
                  int[] indices,
                  DISTANCES distances)
        Assign data to clusters. The results are returned in the indices and distances arrays. The return arrays must have the same length as the data array.
        Parameters:
        data - the data.
        indices - the cluster index for each data point.
        distances - the distance to the closest cluster for each data point.

      • assignDistance

        DISTANCE_INDEX assignDistance(DATATYPE data)
        Assign a single point to a cluster.
        Parameters:
        data - point to assign.
        Returns:
        the cluster index and distance.

      • size

        int size()
        The number of centroids or unique ids that can be generated.
        Returns:
        The number of centroids or unique ids that can be generated.
